citation.article-title: Five new Legionella species isolated from water.

p.s: Description of Legionella quateirensis sp. nov.
Legionella quateirensis (qua. teir. en' sis. N.L. gen. n. quateirensis, coming from Quarteira)
Legionella quateirensis is an oxidase-negative, catalase-positive organism with a single polar flagellum.

It gives positive results in tests for peroxidase activity, browning on agar containing tyrosine or 3,4- or 3,5-diaminobenzoic acid, Î²-lactamase activity, casein hydrolysis, albumin degradation, chondroitin sulfate degradation, starch hydrolysis, DNase activity, gelatin hydrolysis, lipase activity, and protease activity.
It gives negative reactions in tests for hippurate hydrolysis and elastase production.
The type strain is strain 1335 (= ATCC 49507), which has a G+C content of 39 mol%.
